Sentencas: We report on the oxidation and reduction behavior of colloidally stabilized Ni nanoparticles and Pt@NiPt core-shell nanoparticles with a platinum content of 4%.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling

Sentencas: Thin films of both nanoparticle systems were deposited on yttria-stabilized zirconia substrates by spin-coating.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling

Sentencas: Oxidation-reduction cycles were used to remove oxides and organics and obtain metallic particles.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling

Sentencas: The cycling conditions necessary to clean and reduce Pt@NiPt core-shell nanoparticles were milder than for the Ni nanoparticles, which also needed several cycles to burn off residual organics.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling

Sentencas: During cycling, the Ni nanoparticles lost their initially epitaxial relationship with the substrate and adopted a random orientation, while no epitaxial orientation was observable for the core-shell nanoparticles.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling

Sentencas: Reasons for this are discussed together with the influence of platinum on Ni reduction.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling

Sentencas: The Ni and Pt@NiPt nanoparticles sintered during the process but retained crystalline domain diameters close to the original particle diameters.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling

Sentencas: Our results show that colloidally stabilized nanoparticles can be transferred onto a technologically relevant substrate and be reduced to metallic nanoparticles.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling

Sentencas: The fabrication and final structures are discussed as a feasible route to realize solid oxide fuel cell anodes with tailored nickel particle diameter.
Titulo: Durability of Colloidally Stabilized Supported Nickel and Nickel Platinum Nanoparticles during Redox-Cycling
